entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.32.1
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

This update begins the journey toward better accessibility and responsiveness: - Mobile-Friendly UI Enhancements: Booklore’s interface has been refined to better support small-screen devices. Elements like headers, filters, and book cards now scale more effectively and stack intuitively on phones and tablets. This ensures a smoother, more responsive experience whether you’re on a desktop, tablet, or smartphone. - Note: Some components are still pending updates, and further refinements will continue in upcoming versions.

✨ Enhancements

  • Improve UI compatibility for mobile devices (#661) by @adityachandelgit

🛠️ Refactoring & Maintenance

  • Remove lock icon from the book card (#657) by @adityachandelgit

entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.32.2
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

This release brings new features, UI improvements, and important fixes aimed at enhancing usability and maintainability across the app. - Table Column Visibility Configuration: Users can now customize which columns appear in book tables, improving personalization and focus. - Mobile Responsiveness for Metadata Tools: The metadata viewer, editor, picker, and searcher have been updated for better performance and layout on mobile devices. These components now adapt smoothly across screen sizes, continuing the commitment to responsive design. - Reset Reading Progress: Users can now reset their reading progress for any book with a simple action. - Read Status Tracking Fix: Moved read status tracking to a per-user progress entity to resolve inconsistencies in shared or multi-user environments. - Contribution Guidelines: Introduced a CONTRIBUTING.md file to help new contributors get started with setup, development practices, and how to propose changes.

🚀 New Features

  • Feature: add table column visibility configuration (#667) by @adityachandelgit

✨ Enhancements

  • Make metadata viewer, editor, picker, and search mobile responsive (#674) by @adityachandelgit
  • Add ability to reset reading progress for a book (#671) by @adityachandelgit

🐛 Bug Fixes

  • Bugfix: move read status tracking to per-user progress entity (#670) by @adityachandelgit

📖 Documentation

  • Add CONTRIBUTING.md with project setup and contribution guidelines (#669) by @adityachandelgit
  • Merge Develop into Master for release (#675) by @adityachandelgit

📸 Screenshots

entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.33.0
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

This release brings a major upgrade to the metadata editing workflow in Booklore. Previously, bulk metadata refresh was a blind operation, you’d hit refresh and hope for the best. Now, you’re in control.

With the new interactive metadata review system, you can: - Preview fetched metadata before applying it to your books. - Accept, reject, or modify the metadata for each book individually. - Track progress in real time via the updated notification widget.

No more guesswork, just smarter, cleaner, and more reliable metadata updates.

🚀 New Features

  • Implement interactive metadata review for batch updates, with progress tracking and a unified notification system (#702) by @adityachandelgit

✨ Enhancements

  • Restore “Page Count” field in book edit form (#713) by @adityachandelgit
  • Implement accent-insensitive search in global and library-specific search (#712) by @adityachandelgit
  • Add support for updating read status of multiple books at once (#710) by @adityachandelgit
  • Add support for bulk reading progress reset (#708) by @adityachandelgit
  • Update EmailService.java (#692) by @Juror2372

🐛 Bug Fixes

  • Fix correct color rendering issue in Firefox light mode (#714) by @adityachandelgit
  • Fix: Enable nested scrolling in filter accordion panel (#703) by @adityachandelgit

📖 Documentation

  • Merge Develop into Master for release (#715) by @adityachandelgit

entry.title: New release for BookLore: Release v0.34.0
entry.content:
🌟 Changes in this release:

Introducing Bookdrop: Effortless, Automated Book Imports

Gone are the days of manually uploading files. Bookdrop transforms the way you get books into your library:

  • 📂 Just drop your files into a special folder: Bookdrop monitors it in real time.
  • ⚙️ Automatic processing begins instantly: Metadata is fetched, covers are generated, and books are queued for your review.
  • 🔔 Live notifications keep you informed of every step, from detection to completion.
  • 📖 More into at: https://github.com/adityachandelgit/BookLore?tab=readme-ov-file#-bookdrop-folder-auto-import-files-new

Whether you’re syncing from a cloud drive, downloading from a browser, or moving files locally, Bookdrop turns a manual chore into a smart, seamless workflow.

🚀 New Features

  • Implement Bookdrop: Watch folder for file drops and auto-process uploads (#738) by @adityachandelgit

✨ Enhancements

  • Progressive UI Refinements for Mobile and Desktop Layouts (#744) by @adityachandelgit
  • Icon Changes (#727) by @MBaliver

🐛 Bug Fixes

  • Use 100dvh to fix layout issue in mobile devices (#742) by @adityachandelgit

🛠️ Refactoring & Maintenance

  • Adds Upload Status Label and Instructions for Book Uploads (#741) by @adityachandelgit
  • Improve metadata editor layout (#739) by @adityachandelgit
